clinical_study.brief_title: Quality Improvement Project for Advance Care Planning Tool in Hospital Medicine
clinical_study.official_title: Quality Improvement Project: Assessing the Use of Advanced Care Planning Documentation for Patients at High Risk of 30-day Mortality on Hospital Medicine Services

brief_summary.textblock: Hospitalized patients and their families are often unprepared regarding end-of-life care. Even patients with high risk of mortality within the index admission or 30 days after admission often do not have clearly defined goals of care. This lack of clarity can create difficult scenarios for patients, their families, and care providers. Lack of communication and documentation of these goals can lead to unnecessary tests, procedures, and readmissions. By creating advanced care planning education for the hospital medicine department, a standardized note template, and EMR utilization for storage and reference of patient's goals of care documentation we aim to facilitate the conveyance of patient's wishes/preferences across different care providers and across separate encounters within the healthcare system.

intervention.description: Goals of care discussion with patient, documentation with electronic health record note and advance care planning billing. This will also include: pharmacy review of medications, case management review, and coding specialist review.

study_pop.textblock: The study population will include three cohorts in order to evaluate the effectiveness of the program. The intervention cohort consists of adult patients admitted to the hospital medicine service with a high risk of mortality. We will then have two cohorts used to compare outcomes. The first is adult patients admitted to the hospital medicine service who are not at high risk of mortality. The second is adult patients admitted to the hospital who are not on the hospital medicine service. As described in further detail below, data on these three cohorts will be collected during pre-implementation and post-implementation time periods. This study design will enable our team to identify the impact of the program within the intervention group as well as any externalities that impact care across hospital medicine services.

criteria.textblock:

Exclusion Criteria:
